This mega project, centered around a new transshipment port, aims to boost India's role in global shipping. It will reduce reliance on foreign ports and strengthen India's strategic presence near vital sea lanes.

articles.title: UK to make tech firms remove abusive images within 48 hours of alert
articles.summary: Victims of abusive images would have to report them only once for tech companies to remove them from multiple online platforms under the new measures, which could come into force as early as this summer. Failure to act would result in firms facing a fine of up to 10% of their global revenue or having their services blocked in the UK, the government said in a statement.

articles.title: India must move from tech services-led nation to IP-led nation: HCLTech's Roshni Nadar
articles.summary: India's technology sector needs a significant shift. Roshni Nadar Malhotra, HCL Technologies chairperson, advocates for moving from scale-driven growth to an AI-focused, IP-driven model. The future belongs to those who build and own platforms, not just deploy technology. This transformation requires strategic shifts towards IP creation, building capabilities, and establishing a national AI infrastructure.

articles.summary: Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon sees India ready to lead in artificial intelligence. He compares this to India's past success with mobile internet and smartphones. Amon believes AI will bring disruption and create opportunities for India. Qualcomm is excited to support India's growth in AI and its global footprint.

articles.title: India, UK conduct scale-up study of AI-enabled mental health tool for young girls
articles.summary: A significant international project is underway to bring AI-powered mental health support to adolescent girls in rural India. This initiative aims to adapt and scale a digital program, utilising an AI chatbot to address anxiety and low mood.

articles.summary: Alphabet and Google chief executive Sundar Pichai on Wednesday outlined an expansive vision for India’s artificial intelligence future, unveiling fresh investments in infrastructure, skilling, public sector partnerships and scientific research, while positioning India as central to Google’s global AI strategy.

articles.title: India calls for deeper cooperation in R&D, biotech, pharma with Switzerland
articles.summary: India is seeking enhanced collaboration with Switzerland in research, biotechnology, and pharmaceuticals. This move aims to bolster economic relations between the two nations. Swiss investments are also being encouraged in areas of Switzerland's technological expertise.

articles.title: India's agri products, auto exports making greater inroads in EU
articles.summary: India's exports to EU: Of India's USD 19.3 billion in global automotive exports during the first nine months of 2025-26, the EU's share rose to 11.6 per cent from 9.8 per cent in April-December 2024, the data showed.

articles.title: India's consumer inflation estimated at 4.3% in FY27, up from 2.5% in FY26: Crisil
articles.summary: Consumer inflation in India is set to climb to 4.3 percent in fiscal 2027. This rise follows an estimated 2.5 percent in fiscal 2026. Food inflation will normalize from current low levels. Changes in the Consumer Price Index basket will limit the overall increase. Non-food inflation and core inflation are expected to help restrain the rise.

articles.title: India keen to diversify crude oil, coking coal sources; eyes high-quality US supplies: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India aims to diversify its crude oil and coking coal imports, expressing interest in high-quality US coking coal. The nation also seeks US technology like GPUs for AI and data center equipment. India plans to purchase USD 500 billion in goods from America over five years. This trade deal opens opportunities for Indian firms in labor-oriented goods and technology services.

articles.title: India's sugar output likely to reduce
articles.summary: India's sugar production is projected to dip below earlier expectations, primarily due to heavy rainfall affecting sugarcane yields in major growing regions. This downturn could lead to a decrease in the country's sugar exports, providing a potential buffer for global sugar prices.

articles.title: Gujarat govt presents Rs 4.08 lakh crore Budget; big push to tourism, sports infrastructure
articles.summary: Gujarat Budget 2026: Gujarat unveiled a Rs 4.08 lakh crore Budget for 2026-27. The focus is on boosting tourism and developing sports infrastructure for the 2030 Commonwealth Games. Ahmedabad will be developed as an 'Olympic Ready City'. Significant funds are allocated for sports complexes and tourism promotion, including the Statue of Unity and Ambaji. The Budget offers a tax rebate on electric vehicles.

articles.title: Niramala Sitharaman pitches India as a growth hotspot to Norwegian CEOs, eyes deeper trade ties
articles.summary: During a strategic meeting in the heart of Oslo, India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman engaged with top Norwegian business leaders and investors. She highlighted India’s robust trade infrastructure and portrayal as one of the fastest-growing economies globally. Conversations pivoted around lucrative investment avenues in pivotal areas such as renewable energy and rare earth materials.

articles.title: India's oilmeals exports fall 42 pc in January on weak soyabean, rapeseed shipments
articles.summary: India's oilmeal exports saw a significant drop of 42 percent in January. Shipments of soyabean meal and rapeseed meal plunged, impacting the overall figures. Ricebran extraction, however, showed a surge. This decline affects animal feed supplies. Key buyers include China, South Korea, Bangladesh, and Germany. Processors awaited new crop supplies for rapeseed meal.

articles.title: India's textile and apparel exports down by 3.75% in January, outlook improves now with India US interim deal
articles.summary: India's textile and apparel exports saw a dip in January. High tariffs from the United States impacted shipments. However, a recent reduction in these tariffs is expected to boost export competitiveness. This change should support a recovery in textile and apparel shipments in the coming months. The sector's share in India's total exports also saw a decline.

articles.title: Gold, silver import surge pushes India’s January trade deficit to 3-month high of $34.68 billion
articles.summary: Surging gold and silver imports widened India’s January trade deficit to $34.68 billion. Imports jumped 19% while exports barely grew, with services offering limited relief amid weak global demand.

articles.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 5% in January, higher rise for females
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in January, reaching 5%. Joblessness rose more significantly for women compared to men. Rural unemployment edged up, while urban unemployment also increased. The labour force participation rate experienced a minor dip. Youth unemployment also saw a rise, primarily driven by female joblessness.

articles.title: Wholesale inflation touches 10-month high of 1.8% in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation reached a 10-month peak of 1.81 percent in January. This rise was fueled by higher costs for food, non-food articles, and manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw its first reading under a new series. Economists noted a gradual increase in inflation since October 2025. The core WPI segment showed a significant jump.

articles.title: India’s trade deficit widens to $34.68 billion in January as gold imports rise
articles.summary: India's trade deficit surged in January, driven by higher gold and silver imports. Merchandise exports saw a slight dip. However, overall goods and services exports are projected to exceed $860 billion for the fiscal year. Trade pacts with the UAE and EU offer future export growth opportunities. US tariff reductions are expected to boost Indian exports.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises marginally to 5% in January
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate rose to 5% in January. This increase was primarily seen in rural areas. The joblessness rate edged up from 3.9% to 4.2% in villages. Urban unemployment also saw a slight rise. Labour force participation and worker population ratios declined. Seasonal factors and post-harvest slack contributed to the rural slowdown. Urban areas remained stable.

articles.title: Indian bonds dip as U.S.-Iran tensions push oil up
articles.summary: India's government bond yields climbed Friday as escalating U.S.-Iran tensions pushed oil prices to a six-month high, dampening risk appetite. Traders remained cautious ahead of the weekly debt auction, with rising crude prices and supply concerns adding pressure. Long-term overnight index swap rates also increased due to heightened risk aversion.

articles.title: Breakout from lifetime highs: Indian Bank offers derivatives upside play
Stocks in news: Federal Bank, Waaree Energies, ICICI Pru life, Zydus, HUL
articles.summary: Indian markets experienced a downturn on Thursday, with profit-taking and a risk-off sentiment leading to a decline. Key stocks like Federal Bank, ICICI Pru Life, and HUL are in focus due to significant corporate developments, including tax refunds, demands, capacity expansions, and new product launches, impacting investor sentiment.

articles.title: Crude shock for D-Street on fresh US-Iran tensions
articles.summary: Indian stock markets experienced a sharp decline on Thursday. This downturn was driven by escalating tensions between the US and Iran, which pushed Brent crude oil prices above $71 a barrel. The Indian economy's reliance on oil imports makes it vulnerable to such price hikes. The Indian Rupee also weakened against the US Dollar.

articles.title: Can MAS Financial sustain its outperformance on strong growth momentum?
articles.summary: MAS Financial Services (MFSL) has seen a 9% stock gain, outperforming its sector index, driven by double-digit disbursement growth and improving margins. The company aims for ₹1,00,000 crore AUM by 2036, with analysts maintaining a 'buy' rating and raising targets due to attractive valuations and strong growth prospects.

articles.title: Reliance puts $110 billion on table, joins Adani & Tata in big-ticket AI buildout
articles.summary: India Inc is making massive AI moves, with Reliance Industries pledging $110 billion over seven years to build AI-focused infrastructure. Tata Group is partnering with OpenAI to scale AI-ready data centres. Adani Enterprises also plans a $100 billion investment by 2035, signalling a major national push into AI.

articles.title: AI services a real opportunity for IT to adapt, move fast
articles.summary: Vinod Khosla says AI could transform the world into an era of abundance, where people need not work and can pursue their passions. He warns that India’s IT services industry must adapt quickly to offer AI services globally or risk obsolescence. The country’s talent and cost advantages create a major opportunity.

articles.title: $1.5-trillion tech services industry is still standing: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh
articles.summary: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh says the $1.5 trillion global tech services industry is far from being destroyed, despite AI compressing some areas. He sees significant growth opportunities in six key segments. Parekh adds that the Indian IT industry is likely to thrive by 2030 by leveraging these areas.

articles.title: What's happening in India with AI is really amazing: Sam Altman lauds speed of tech adoption
articles.summary: Highlighting the rapid adoption of tools like Codex, which he expects to become the world's largest market "pretty quickly", Altman signalled that India's tech ecosystem is on the verge of a massive, AI-driven entrepreneurial explosion.

articles.title: Don't want AI to be one-size-fits-all: Meta's chief AI officer Alexander Wang
articles.summary: Meta said its personal superintelligence, set to be launched in the next few months, will go beyond routine administrative tasks. ​​It will help users manage health goals, plan events, pursue hobbies and engage more meaningfully with their communities, the company’s newly appointed chief AI officer and leader of its Superintelligence Labs, Alexandr Wang, said on Thursday.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman defends AI use of news content
articles.summary: Sam Altman, chief executive officer of OpenAI, on Thursday defended use of copyright news articles and opinion pieces in training AI models like ChatGPT, saying it followed the US principle of fair use.

articles.title: India can become a global AI innovation hub: Mistral CEO Arthur Mensch
articles.summary: French startup Mistral AI’s cofounder and chief executive Arthur Mensch feels India can become a global innovation hub for AI due to its talent pool and industrial strength, adding that a quarter of his firm’s researchers are Indians.

articles.title: Google chief Sundar Pichai visits Coffee Board stall at AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai visited the Commerce Ministry's Coffee Board stall at the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi. He participated in the summit, which began on Monday. The summit is the world's largest artificial intelligence event. India is pushing for wider access to AI. Pichai described AI as ushering in an era of hyper progress.

articles.title: AI is an incredible power and is deeply disruptive: Vishal Sikka
articles.summary: There is a gap between LLMs and their business users, and bridging it is an opportunity, said Vishal Sikka, founder and chief executive of Viani, as he delivered his keynote speech at the India AI Impact Summit, 2026, on Thursday.

articles.title: India can become one of the world's most consequential AI environments: Wipro's Rishad Premji
articles.summary: India has the opportunity to become one of the world's most consequential environments for AI application but the country's advantage will be defined by the choices it makes regarding where to apply, diffuse and responsibly deploy the new wave of technology to translate capability into real impact, Wipro executive chairman, Rishad Premji said on Thursday.

articles.title: Balancing AI and copyright; Adani's $100B bet
articles.summary: Day 2 of the India AI Impact Summit featured additional announcements, sessions, and policy discussions focused on emerging technology. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Passenger vehicle sales keep the momentum in Jan, rise in double digits for a 4th month
articles.summary: Indian auto sales are off to a strong start in the new year. Passenger vehicle sales saw double-digit growth for the fourth month running in January. Two- and three-wheeler segments also posted significant gains. This positive trend indicates sustained demand and supports economic activity across the country. The automotive sector is poised for continued growth.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: Paparo visit signals steady reset in India-US military cooperation
articles.summary: Adm. Samuel J. Paparo’s visit to India highlights deepening US-India defence ties, focusing on the Quad, interoperability, and the 2025 Framework, amid ongoing high-level military engagements.

articles.title: Omnitech Engineering fixes price band for its ₹583 crore IPO
articles.summary: Retail investors can bid for a minimum of 66 shares for 14,982 and in multiples thereafter. As much as 35% or 89.72 lakh shares of the offer worth ₹203.68 crore are reserved for retail investors.

articles.title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei: AI could transform India’s economy, but disruption must be managed
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said AI has the potential to lift millions out of poverty and significantly expand India’s economic growth. However, he cautioned that the technology could also cause disruption, calling for close coordination with governments to manage its impact.

articles.title: Nirmala Sitharaman meets Norwegian CEOs to discuss India investment scope
articles.summary: Speaking at the session with 35 Norwegian CEOs and investors in Oslo, FM Nirmala Sitharaman said, 'My official visit to Norway has witnessed engaging and positive discussions on India as an investment destination and the fastest growing major economy of the world.'

articles.title: AI is a 'civilisational change': N Chandrasekaran sees big opportunity for India’s IT
articles.summary: Calling AI a civilisation-scale shift, N Chandrasekaran says enterprise adoption will unlock latent demand, positioning India’s IT services firms for large-scale transformation opportunities.

articles.title: Food Secretary: India's sugar supply "comfortably" placed despite production estimates down by 13 LT
articles.summary: India's sugar production is estimated at 330 LT, with consumption at 290 LT, ensuring surplus. AISTA reports 2.01 LT exports in 2025-26, mainly to UAE, Afghanistan, Djibouti, and Bhutan.

articles.title: Gokaldas Exports expects 12-15% revenue growth in FY27 as US sourcing returns
articles.summary: Gokaldas Exports is expanding in Europe and continuing diversification. It also plans capex of around ₹175 crore over two years and is open to expansion through acquisitions. Management said trade deals and tariff normalisation could support textile exports and jobs growth.

articles.title: Why India’s cash in circulation hit ₹40 lakh crore despite record UPI surge? Check here
articles.summary: India’s currency in circulation hits ₹40 lakh crore, while UPI transactions reach ₹28.3 lakh crore monthly. SBI Research notes digital payments are driving incremental GDP growth amid rising cash.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises to 5% in January 2026
articles.summary: India’s unemployment rate rose to 5% in January 2026, with overall labour force participation rate (LFPR) at 55.9% and worker population ratio (WPR) at 53.1%. Urban and rural workforce participation remained largely stable as did female LFPR, month-on-month.

articles.title: India's trade deficit soars to record high as gold imports surge
articles.summary: For the April–January period, merchandise exports rose 2.22% to $366.63 billion, while imports climbed 7.21% to $649.86 billion, keeping the deficit elevated.

articles.title: Bill Gates meets Andhra CM Naidu in Amaravati ahead of AI Impact Summit; discusses health, agri, and tech
articles.summary: Bill Gates visited Amaravati, met Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu to discuss health, agriculture, and tech collaboration ahead of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 10-month high in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation rose to 1.81% in January from 0.83%, mainly due to higher food prices and increased manufacturing sector costs. Certain kitchen items remain significantly cheaper than a year ago.

articles.title: Nykaa to bring viral Korean skincare brand medicube to India
articles.summary: Nykaa has teamed up with South Korea’s APR Corporation to bring viral skincare brand medicube to India, expanding its Korean beauty portfolio across online and offline channels.

articles.title: KEI sees ₹25,000 crore opportunity for cable industry on data centre push
articles.summary: KEI Industries CMD Anil Gupta expects 20% annual growth and said imports are not a concern, with domestic players well equipped to supply large projects.

articles.title: A weak summer could spell disaster for AC industry: Blue Star MD

articles.title: TCS gets into AI-collaboration race, partners with Sam Altman's OpenAI

articles.title: TVS Supply Chain sees defence logistics opportunity as India market expands

The partnership with ALA is currently at the MOU stage, with revenue sharing to be decided project-wise. Defence business is expected to support margin improvement for the company.

articles.summary: CIE Automotive India reported a 10.4% rise in Q3 net profit to ₹204 crore, with revenue up 13.4%, while margins slightly dipped year-on-year.

articles.title: Foreign investors continue to buy PSU bank shares even as $19 billion leaves India

Financing penetration of education spend is increasing. Students are exploring new study destinations.
